missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} The <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> is Weiss. Apply +6 Health to Weiss. Apply +1 {G} to each of his defense results.
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 2 (only once per round per terminal).
{-} The door is locked to Rebel figures. A Rebel figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to open it.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The Rebels win when Weiss is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

Desperate after the loss of their engineering facility, High Command wishes to recover ground.

Thus, you're sent directly to Coruscant. Your task is to find final, detailed schematics of the weapon and bring them back at all costs.

It takes days of infiltration before you can get to Coruscant and find Weiss's facility.  Executing a plan to get inside is no easier, but fortunately you manage it without incident. With explosives laid to cover an emergency retreat, you sneak through the dark corners of the base.

"General Weiss has arrived," a message blares in the corridors, bringing with it a new idea and opportunity.

If you were to defeat and capture the general, not only could he be interrogated, but his plans would certainly falter without his guiding hand.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 2 (only once per round per terminal).
{-} The door is locked to Rebel figures. A Rebel figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to open it.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.newInstructions: {-} Interact with a terminal (only once per round per terminal).

eventActions.tbText: {-} Deploy an <color="red">Imperial Officer</color>. This is Weiss.

eventActions.customText:
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 8 or less that can perform an attack attacks {R1}.
{A} The other Imperial figure with the highest figure cost becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

eventActions.tbText:
General Weiss's voice rings out from behind a door, shouting orders.

{-} The <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> is Weiss. Apply +6 Health to Weiss. Apply +1 {G} to each of his defense results.
{-} The Rebels win when Weiss is defeated.

events.eventText:
There is no weapon. There never was.

After sealing off the area, you attempt  to retrieve the final schematics from Weiss's computer. Instead, you find a series of battle plans, contingencies, and positioning of a substantial Imperial fleet. All of this lies waiting for a Rebel attack at the location of the weapon's supposed development. An ambush.

"It was almost too easy to fool you." Weiss remains calm as you lead him toward your escape tunnel. "You 're always so desperate to make a last stand. It is easy to encourage."

An explosion blasts through one of the sealed doors as he  finishes speaking. Seizing the opportunity, Weiss pulls free of your grasp, diving to the ground as a hail of blaster fire pours through the opening.

"I'm fine, go after them!" he shouts, shaking off the assistance of Imperial soldiers and pointing down the hangar toward you.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Place Story Mission card "Last Stand" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Because the Rebels defeated Weiss before he entered the AT-ST, they receive an additional 100 credits per hero.

"After them!" Weiss commands. "Don't allow them to escape!" Knowing the task has failed, you trigger the explosive charges you planted and set off down your escape route.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Place Story Mission card "Desperate Hour" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

events.eventName: End of Mission - Rebels win late
events.eventText:
There is no weapon. There never was.

After sealing off the area, you attempt  to retrieve the final schematics from Weiss's computer. Instead, you find a series of battle plans, contingencies, and positioning of a substantial Imperial fleet. All of this lies waiting for a Rebel attack at the location of the weapon's supposed development. An ambush.

"It was almost too easy to fool you." Weiss remains calm as you lead him toward your escape tunnel. "You 're always so desperate to make a last stand. It is easy to encourage."

An explosion blasts through one of the sealed doors as he  finishes speaking. Seizing the opportunity, Weiss pulls free of your grasp, diving to the ground as a hail of blaster fire pours through the opening.

"I'm fine, go after them!" he shouts, shaking off the assistance of Imperial soldiers and pointing down the hangar toward you.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Place Story Mission card "Last Stand" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Because the Rebels defeated Weiss only after he entered the AT-ST, the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.

eventActions.newInstructions:
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 8 or less that can perform an attack attacks {R1}.
{Q} If this figure did not use ORDER, move 4 to attack {R1}. Apply +2 {H} to the attack.
{Q} Move 2 to attack {R1}. Apply +2 {H} to the attack.
{A} Move 4 to engage the other Imperial figure with the most Health remaining.
{A} If this figure is not adjacent to another Imperial figure, move 5 to reposition 6.
{-} COWER: If adjacent to another Imperial figure, recover 2 {H}. The adjacent non-<color="red">Focused</color> Imperial figure with the highest figure cost becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

{Q} Attack {R1}. Apply +2 {H} to the attack.
{A} Move 3 to interact with the inactive AT-ST.
{A} Move 5 to interact with the inactive AT-ST.
{-} COWER: If adjacent to another Imperial figure, recover 2 {H}. The adjacent non-<color="red">Focused</color> Imperial figure with the highest figure cost becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

events.eventText:
The elevator arrives. In a crouched position sits a scout walker covered in advanced weaponry. It lays still and silent, lacking a pilot. An encoded lock with a palm reader lies near the hatch. Even if you weren't in a fire fight, you don't know if you'd be able to crack it.

{-} Deploy <color="red">General Weiss</color> to the red highlighted spaces. This is the inactive AT-ST. Apply +1 {G} to each of <color="red">General Weiss</color>'s defense results.
{-} <color="red">General Weiss</color> (inactive AT-ST) is an Imperial figure that cannot move or attack, but can still be attacked.
{-} Weiss (<color="red">Imperial Officer</color>) can interact with the inactive AT-ST to enter it. When that happens, click on the red highlighted spaces and select "Weiss enters AT-ST".

eventActions.theText:
{-} The <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> is Weiss. Apply +6 Health to Weiss. Apply +1 {G} to each of his defense results.
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 2 (only once per round per terminal).
{-} The door is locked to Rebel figures. A Rebel figure can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to open it.
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} <color="red">General Weiss</color> (inactive AT-ST) is an Imperial figure that cannot move or attack, but can still be attacked.
{-} Weiss (<color="red">Imperial Officer</color>) can interact with the inactive AT-ST to enter it. When that happens, click on the red highlighted spaces and select "Weiss enters AT-ST".
{-} The Rebels win when Weiss is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Deploy <color="red">General Weiss</color> (inactive AT-ST) here.

When Weiss interacts with the inactive AT-ST, click "Weiss enters AT-ST".

events.eventText: The sight of his walker arriving fills General Weiss with determination.

eventActions.mainText: Does Weiss have line of sight to a Rebel figure?

events.eventText:
Weiss raises his blaster pistol and takes aim.

{-} Weiss recovers 5 {H} and interrupts to attack {rebel}.

Weiss rushes towards the walker.

{-} Weiss moves 5 towards the inactive AT-ST.

The sight of his walker arriving fills General Weiss with determination.

{-} Open the door.
{-} Weiss moves 3 towards the inactive AT-ST.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
General Weiss can be heard behind this door, shouting orders at his troops.

The door is locked to heroes. A hero can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.

events.eventText:
Covered by his troops, Weiss makes a mad dash toward his vehicle, palming the entrance hatch and slipping inside. 

"Yes. This is much better." His augmented voice echoes in the wide hangar as the walker powers up and swivels toward you. "Now, where were we?"

{-} Discard the <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> figure and its Deployment card. It is not defeated.
{-} <color="red">General Weiss</color> recovers 6 {H}.
{-} <color="red">General Weiss</color> now activates as normal. Apply +1 {G} to each of his defense results.
{-} The Rebels win when <color="red">General Weiss</color> is defeated.

eventActions.theText:
{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 2 (only once per round per terminal).
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}).
{-} The Rebels win when Weiss is defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Deploy <color="red">General Weiss</color> (inactive AT-ST) here.

When Weiss interacts with the inactive AT-ST, click "Weiss enters AT-ST".

General Weiss can be heard behind this door, shouting orders at his troops.

The door is locked to heroes. A hero can interact with the door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.

eventActions.mainText:
The door is locked tight.

Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The door withstands your attempts. You need to keep trying.

{-} For each {B} result, place 1 strain token on the door.

events.eventText: More alarms blare through the facility, calling in reinforcements.
The comm station explodes in a shower of sparks.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The comlink terminal allows the Imperials to call for reinforcements.

{-} An Imperial figure can interact with a terminal to increase {D} by 2. When it does, click "Increase {D}".
{-} A Rebel figure can attack a terminal (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}).
